item.title: about me
item.dc:creator: Zach Stoebner
item.description: Hi, I'm Zach! I leverage machine learning to solve challenging problems in neuroscience, computer vision, & intelligent systems. I’m currently a graduate student researcher in VISE MedICL at Vanderbilt University investigating applied ML for medical and neuroscientific data. Generally, I’m curious about ML & neuroscience, intelligent systems & robotics, and optimization & control theory. Check out my projects to see what I’m working on, notes to see what I’m thinking about, and kū to see what I’m seeing! CV GitHub LinkedIn Goodreads
item.content:encoded: Hi, I'm Zach! I leverage machine learning to solve challenging problems in neuroscience, computer vision, &amp; intelligent systems. I&rsquo;m currently a graduate student researcher in VISE MedICL at Vanderbilt University investigating applied ML for medical and neuroscientific data. Generally, I&rsquo;m curious about ML &amp; neuroscience, intelligent systems &amp; robotics, and optimization &amp; control theory. Check out my projects to see what I&rsquo;m working on, notes to see what I&rsquo;m thinking about, and kū to see what I&rsquo;m seeing! CV GitHub LinkedIn Goodreads I graduated from Vandy in May 2021 with a B.S. in computer science and neuroscience, minoring in applied math. I expect to complete my M.S. in computer science, also at Vandy, in May 2022. Currently, I am applying to PhD programs that encourage interdisciplinary research at the intersection of my interests. Please reach out to me at +15125477486 or zachary.a.stoebner@vanderbilt.edu if you would like to work with me! During undergrad, I was a mentor in the VUSE Design Studio. I have had the privilege to assist with courses on discrete structures, operating systems, deep learning, and currently AI. Beyond research, I enjoy heavy weights, friendship, haiku &amp; senryu, hendiadys, esports, kombucha, cucumber cocktails, and sunset runs. Occasionally, I take a good photo and write a kū to pair with it. I especially like to take shameless photoshoots of my cats, Amie and Chaussure. I am a Lusophone &gt; Hispanophone &gt; Francophone. I self-studied Portuguese throughout high school, then I took a crucial gap year of emotional and linguistic growth in Lisbon, Portugal. My hometown is Austin, TX, and I hope one day I can live there again as a scientist guiding the future of tech. I am always open to new opportunities, especially those that align with my interests. You can contact me at zachary.a.stoebner@vanderbilt.edu.
